'''Amos Manor''' ({{lang-he|עמוס מנור}}; October 8, 1918 – August 5, 2007), born '''Arthur Mendelowitz''', was Director of the [[Shin Bet]], [[Israel|Israel's]] internal intelligence and security service, from 1953 until 1963.
He was born into a Jewish family in [[Sighetu Marmației]], in [[Máramaros County]], [[Austria-Hungary]] (present-day [[Romania]]). Following the outbreak of [[World War II]], he was drafted to the [[Hungarian Army]], but in 1944 was deported to the [[Auschwitz concentration camp]]. In 1947, he joined the [[Mossad LeAliyah Bet]], an organization dedicated to smuggling Jews into Palestine in defiance of British immigration restrictions, becoming secretary of its Romanian branch in [[Budapest]]. He served under the alias "Amos", which he later adopted as his first name. He immigrated to Israel in 1949, and joined the Shin Bet a month afterwards.<ref>[http://www.shabak.gov.il/English/History/heads/Pages/AmosManor.aspx Amos Manor<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
Amos Manor is credited with building up the Shin Bet as a national institution capable of handling the many threats posed to internal Israeli security during that time.
In 1964 Manor began serving on the directorial board of several companies, banks and the stock market. He also worked as a business consultant for various textile firms. He was also a partner in the Atlas hotel management company.
Amos Manor spoke fluent Hebrew, Yiddish, English, French, German, Romanian and Hungarian.<ref>[http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-3433999,00.html Former Shin Bet chief Amos Manor dies, age 89 - Israel News, Ynetnews<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
In the ISA 1949 - appointed department head in the division for non-Arab affairs, and became the first department director for Eastern Europe.
1950 - appointed unit head within the division for non-Arab affairs.
1952 - appointed Deputy ISA Director
1953 - appointed ISA Director
1964 - retired from the ISA.
Following his service in the ISA, and until he died, Manor worked for a Swiss investment company active in Israel, as a consultant to various companies, and served as director of a number of companies. He was the chairman of the board of directors of a number of banks and of the stock exchange and was also a partner in the Atlas company for hotel management.

{{Use mdy dates|date=June 2013}} {{Chinese name|[[Bao (surname)|Bao]]}} {{Chinese |pic=Chinese ex-official Bao Tong at home (cropped).jpg |piccap=Bao Tong at his Beijing home in 2008 |s=鲍彤 |t=鮑彤 |p=Bào Tóng }} '''Bao Tong''' (born November 1932) is a Chinese writer and activist. He was former Director of the [[Central Policy Research Office|Office of Political Reform]] of the [[Central Committee of the Communist Party of China|Central Committee]] of the [[Communist Party of China]] and the Policy Secretary of [[Zhao Ziyang]], [[Chinese Premier]] from 1980 to 1987 and [[CPC General Secretary]] from 1987 to 1989. He was also Director of the Drafting Committee for the CPC 13th [[National Congress of the Communist Party of China|Party Congresses]], known for its strong support for market reform and opening up under [[Deng Xiaoping]]. Prior to this, he was a committee member and then Deputy Director of the Chinese State Commission for Economic Reform. ==Biography== Bao was born in [[Haining]], [[Zhejiang]] Province, but grew up in Shanghai. He currently lives in Beijing with his wife Jiang Zongcao, his daughter Bao Jian, and granddaughter Bao Yangyang. His son, Bao Pu, lives abroad.{{cn|date=March 2018}} Bao was Director of the [[Central Policy Research Office|Office of Political Reform]] of the [[CPC Central Committee]] and the Policy Secretary of [[Zhao Ziyang]], Chinese Premier from 1980 to 1987 and CPC General Secretary from 1987 to 1989. He was also Director of the Drafting Committee for the CPC 13th [[National Congress of the Communist Party of China|Party Congresses]], prior to which he was a committee member and then Deputy Director of the Chinese State Commission for Economic Reform. On May 28, 1989, he was arrested in Beijing just before the crushing of the democracy movement in [[Tiananmen Square]] on [[Tiananmen Square protests of 1989|June 4, 1989]]. Zhao Ziyang had resigned as [[General Secretary of the Communist Party of China]] in protest when [[Deng Xiaoping]] made the decision to crack down on the students. Bao Tong was a close associate of Zhao and the writer of his speeches and editorials supporting a democratic and legal approach to the student movement. Zhao was held under house arrest for the rest of his life, while Bao Tong was officially charged with "revealing state secrets and counter-revolutionary propagandizing", the highest government official to be charged in relation to the 1989 movement. He was publicly convicted in 1992 in a brief show trial and sentenced to 7 seven years' imprisonment with 2 years deprivation of political rights. He served his full sentence in isolation at [[Qincheng Prison]]. On May 27, 1996, when he was due to be released upon completing his prison sentence, he was instead held at a government compound in Xishan (outside Beijing) for an additional year, until his family agreed to move out of their apartment in town to one allocated for them by the authorities, where a 24-hour guarded gate and surveillance cameras were installed. Visitors were screened, the phone was tapped or cut off entirely, and Bao Tong was followed by an entourage of men the moment he stepped out of his home. Though he has moved to another apartment in Beijing, the system of surveillance and curtailing his phone calls, visitors and movements has followed him to his new home. Bao Tong appealed for the restoration of civil and political rights of Zhao Ziyang from 1998 until Zhao's death. He was instrumental to the publication in May 2009 of Zhao Ziyang's memoir, based on audiotapes that Zhao made secretly while under house arrest and discovered after his death in 2005. Bao Tong's son Bao Pu, and daughter-in-law Renee Chiang, published the book ''Journey of Reform'' ([[:zh:改革历程|改革歷程]]) in Hong Kong and translated and edited (along with [[Adi Ignatius]]) an English version of this book entitled [[Prisoner of the State: The Secret Journal of Premier Zhao Ziyang]]. Bao Tong wrote an introduction for the Chinese version. Bao Tong continues to write articles openly critical of the government and its policies. He supports further democratic development in Hong Kong and continues to voice the need for political reform in China.{{Cite web| url = http://www.chinaaffairs.org/gb/ArticleList.asp?writerID=74 | title = Writers' columns - Bao Tong |accessdate = August 1, 2006 | publisher = Chinaaffairs.org }} He was a signer of the [[Charter 08]] manifesto and calls for the release of [[Liu Xiaobo]], an organiser of the charter who was arrested in December 2008. On January 19, 2005, the Washington Post reported that Bao Tong and his wife were injured in attacks by more than 20 plainclothes security agents as they attempted to leave their home to pay their respect to the family of Zhao Ziyang, who died on January 17. The authorities would only allow him access to a doctor if he removed a white flower pinned to his vest. He refused.{{Cite web|url=http://www.asiaamerica.org/Backup/ChinaInFocus.html |title=China in Focus #1 |date=January 20, 2005 |publisher=asiaamerica.org |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20060523032924/http://www.asiaamerica.org/Backup/ChinaInFocus.html |archivedate=May 23, 2006 |df=mdy }} (''Note that the white flower is a traditional symbol of mourning'') His wife, pushed to the ground by a policeman, fractured a bone in her spine that had her hospitalized for 3 months. On January 1, 2007, Reuters tested a new government relaxing of regulations on foreign reporters by visiting Bao Tong at his home, purportedly to conduct an interview about the Beijing Olympics. Since then, several foreign reporters have done the same. The guards sometimes attempt to intimidate or deny visitation, but are apparently allowing most foreign reporters to enter, if prior arrangements are made. Local Chinese reporters are not included in this new relaxation of regulations. Sky News reporter Peter Sharp describes his visit to Bao Tong in his blog.{{Cite web| url = http://skynews6.typepad.com/my_weblog/2008/01/in-the-tiananme.html| title = In A Tiananmen Rebel's Glass Prison | date = January 17, 2008 | publisher = sky.com }} Their home telephone continues to be tapped and periodically cut off, especially when overseas callers ask to speak to Bao Tong. He is followed everywhere he goes, and is occasionally blocked from “sensitive” events or places, for example, the home of Zhao Ziyang while he was alive, and his funeral after his death in 2005. Bao has been allowed to leave Beijing on three occasions since his arrest in 1989, the last time in 2009 for a holiday by invitation and escort of the Public Security from May 22 to June 7, neatly avoiding the 20th anniversary of the [[Tiananmen Square protests of 1989|Tiananmen Massacre]]. Visits from his son, Bao Pu, a resident of Hong Kong, are permitted by special arrangements only; under normal circumstances of application, he is unable to obtain a visa. ==Quotes== * On CPC leadership: "We must correct all of Deng Xiaoping's mistakes. This is the only way to truly uphold Deng Xiaoping's vision. This is what it truly means to carry on Deng Xiaoping's work. Only when they acknowledge his mistakes and correct his mistakes can they stand taller than Deng Xiaoping. Otherwise they have no right to call themselves Deng Xiaoping's successors. They can only call themselves the successors of Deng Xiaoping's mistakes."{{Cite web| url = http://edition.cnn.com/WORLD/asiapcf/9906/02/tiananmen/MacKinnon/bao.tong.html | title = Former Community Party official: Last decade 'wasted' | date = June 2, 1999 | work = Rebecca McKinnon | publisher = CNN }} * On mourning Zhao Ziyang: "[his] life formed part of a heroic and mighty task, that of pioneering the protection of human rights and democracy for the Chinese people... To mourn Zhao is to defend human rights. To mourn Zhao is to pursue democracy and the rule of law."{{Cite web|url=http://www.asiaamerica.org/Backup/ChinaInFocus.html |title=China in Focus #1 |date=January 20, 2005 |publisher=asiaamerica.org |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20060523032924/http://www.asiaamerica.org/Backup/ChinaInFocus.html |archivedate=May 23, 2006 |df=mdy }} * On the [[2008 Chinese milk scandal]]: "The tainted milk scandal shows us that the more dark secrets are exposed, the better. You can't cure the disease, or save the Chinese people, until you get to the root of the problem." "If the Chinese government tries to play down this incident, there will be no social stability in China, let alone harmony... It will mean that this government has lost the most basic level of trust."{{Cite web|url=http://www.rfa.org/english/news/china/milk-09232008075809.html?searchterm=None |title= Uproar Over China Milk Scandal |publisher= [[Radio Free Asia]]|date= September 23, 2008}} ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.rfa.org/english/search?search_text%3Autf8%3Austring=Bao+Tong&submit= Bao Tong Articles on RFA.org] *[http://www.ft.com/cms/s/2/19be8a24-4bdf-11de-b827-00144feabdc0.html Financial Times profiles Bao Tong] *[https://www.wsj.com/articles/SB124363905516167931 Wall Street Journal interviews Bao Tong] *[https://web.archive.org/web/20050313004014/http://www.alliance.org.hk/prison/?lang=c Alliance Introduction] *[http://www.project-syndicate.org/contributor/406 Project Syndicate] *[https://web.archive.org/web/20060904104150/http://www.laogai.org/dissent/show.php?code=117&n= Laogai.org] {{start box}} {{s-ppo}} {{s-bef|before=[[Lin Mu]]
([[Hu Yaobang]] office)}} {{s-ttl|title=Office Chief of the [[General Secretary of the Communist Party of China]]
([[Zhao Ziyang]] Office)|years=January 1987 － June 1989}} {{s-aft|after=[[Jia Ting'an]]
([[Jiang Zemin]] office)}} {{end box}} {{1989 Tiananmen protests}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Bao, Tong}} [[Category:1932 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Chinese dissidents]] [[Category:Prisoners and detainees of the People's Republic of China]] [[Category:Charter 08 signatories]] [[Category:Place of birth missing (living people)]] [[Category:People's Republic of China politicians from Zhejiang]] [[Category:Communist Party of China politicians from Zhejiang]] [[Category:Expelled members of the Chinese Communist Party]] [[Category:People from Haining]]

{{Infobox person | name =Beatrice Long Visitor Holy Dance | image = | caption = |tribe =Oglala Lakota | birth_name = | birth_date = | birth_place =[[Pine Ridge Reservation]] | death_date = | death_place = | other_names = | height =4 ft. 10 in. | known_for = Work with [[International Council of 13 Indigenous Grandmothers]] opposing papal bulls authorizing the conversion and subjugation of indigenous peoples | occupation =Lakota keeper of the traditional ways, [[Activist]], Field Health Care Worker, [[Native American Church]] elder, [[sundancer]] |parents =Antonia Long Visitor Holy Dance (mother) |relations =[[Rita Long Visitor Holy Dance]], Long Visitor, Loretta Long Visitor }} '''Beatrice Long Visitor Holy Dance''' is a [[Native Americans in the United States|Native American]] spiritual [[American Indian elder|elder]] who is a member of the [[Oglala Lakota]] Tribe and comes from the [[Pine Ridge Reservation]] in South Dakota. Beatrice has gained international recognition through her work with the Council of the [[International Council of 13 Indigenous Grandmothers]] - a group of women elders, [[Medicine man|medicine women]] and wisdom keepers founded in 2004.Schaefer (2006) p.2 == Biography == Beatrice was sent to a [[Roman Catholic]] boarding school at age 7. She waited for her younger sister [[Rita Long Visitor Holy Dance|Rita]] to wed and the two enjoyed a double wedding.Schaefer (2006) p.66 She is a "[[Native American Church]] elder, sundancer, and health worker for people with diabetes," and works on a Youth Ambassador program with her sister to connect young people with spirituality and the [[Sun Dance]].{{Cite web | title = Beatrice Long-Visitor Holy Dance | work = [[Omega Institute for Holistic Studies]] | accessdate = 2013-06-17 | url = http://www.eomega.org/workshops/teachers/beatrice-long-visitor-holy-dance }} {{quote|Among Beatrice's themes in her talks is forgiveness, something she has experience with. As a child, she watched as Christian missionaries stamped out the Lakota faith, and the federal government rounded up Lakotas and placed them on reservations. She also endured the murders of two of her children, one in 1994 and another in 2007. "I pray for the people who did that to them," Beatrice told me. "I pray that they have a clean soul and will someday be in the Creator's arms."{{Cite news | title = THE PULPIT: Lakota 'Grandma' walks and talks peace, forgiveness | work = [[The Gazette (Colorado Springs)|The Gazette]] | location = Colorado Springs | accessdate = 2013-06-17 | date = 2009-04-24 | url = http://gazette.com/article/52384 }}}} She has driven a truck on the reservation for decades delivering medicines. In 2012 she hosted a workshop for girls on "how to properly cut buffalo meat and dry it."{{Cite web | title = Medicine Wheel Healing Community News | accessdate = 2013-06-17 | url = http://www.medicinewhl.org/newse.htm }} == Quote ==
We have to keep repeating the prayers over and over again. When I reflect on my life of 79 years, I see a flat road of destruction. Youths are dying of drugs and ozone layer is depleting. The most powerful tool with us is to pray and pray with other communities for world peace.{{Cite news | last = Mohan | first = Vibhor | title = 13 ‘grandmothers’ pray for world peace | work = The Tribune | location = Chandigarh, India - Himachal Pradesh | accessdate = 2013-06-21 | date = 2006-10-15 | url = http://www.tribuneindia.com/2006/20061016/himachal.htm#4 }}
== The International Council of 13 Grandmothers == {{Main|International Council of 13 Grandmothers}} In 2004, Beatrice was approached by [[The Center for Sacred Studies]] to serve on the [[International Council of 13 Indigenous Grandmothers]].Supriano, S, (2009-04-06) In 2009, [[The Gazette (Colorado Springs)|The Gazette]] of [[Colorado Springs, Colorado]] described her schedule with the Grandmothers as "hectic", noting that she traveled by "Greyhound bus or car, driven by her daughter Loretta Long Visitor." In 2008, she joined the Grandmothers in delivering a petition to [[Pope Benedict XVI]] in [[Vatican City]] by hand, requesting the Pope to revoke the three papal bulls authorizing the conversion and subjugation of the indigenous peoples of the Americas.Capriccioso, R, Jul 17, 2008 (Updated: Apr 24, 2009), [http://www.indiancountrytoday.com/archive/28396744.html ''Indigenous grandmas nearly kicked out of Vatican'']. [[Indian Country Today Media Network|Indian Country Today]] The Papal Bulls that the Grandmothers are demanding to be revoked are: *[[Dum Diversas]], June 18, 1452 *[[Romanus Pontifex]], January 8, 1455 *[[Inter Caetera]], May 4, 1493Chittister (2009) The Grandmothers received no response after this request. However, the letter which Beatrice Long Visitor Holy Dance wrote on this topic was featured on the [[National Catholic Reporter]] website, under the title "The past is a very living thing: Try not to forget it."Chittister, J, April 24, 2009, Blog on [[National Catholic Reporter]] website, [http://ncronline.org/blogs/where-i-stand/past-very-living-thing-try-not-forget-it ''The past is a very living thing: Try not to forget it'']. She was interviewed on her work with the Council by the Women Rising Radio Project in 2011.{{Cite web | title = Women Rising XI: International Council of the 13 Indigenous Grandmothers | work = Women Rising Radio Project | accessdate = 2013-06-17 | date = 2011-10-21 | url = http://www.womenrisingradio.com/2011/10/21/women-rising-xi-international-council-of-the-13-indigenous-grandmothers/#more-%27 }} 2016 After serving on the Council of the Thirteen Indigenous Grandmother's for twelve years, Beatrice Long Visitor Holy Dance died in 2016; her life was celebrated for four days from 25 August to 28 August 2016 with a Creation to Completion Ceremony in Phoenicia, New York where the grandmothers first began their mission.{{Cite news|url=http://www.pressrepublican.com/news/wisdom-teachings-for-seven-generations/article_4fcbabf4-5f6e-52c5-a380-4e4dd0ceeacc.html|title=Wisdom teachings for seven generations|last=Press-Republican|first=ROBIN CAUDELL|work=Press-Republican|access-date=2017-04-04|language=en}}{{Cite web|url=http://menla.us/retreat/430/creation-to-completion/|title=Creation to Completion|last=|first=|date=|website=Menla|access-date=}}{{Cite web|url=http://www.grandmotherscouncil.org/in-honor-of-grandmother-beatrice|title=International Council of Thirteen Indigenous Grandmothers Events and Updates|last=|first=|date=|website=|access-date=}} == Notes == {{Reflist|2}} == References == *Grandmothers' Council website, [http://www.grandmotherscouncil.com/about.html#Beatrice About the Grandmothers] *Native Village Publications, [http://www.nativevillage.org/INTERNATIONAL%20COUNCIL%20OF%2013%20INDIGENOUS%20GR/Each%20GR%20Home%20Page/Rita%20and%20Beatrice/Grandmother%20Rita%20and%20Beatrice%20Homepage.htm Grandmother Beatrice Long Visitor Holy Dance] *Sacred Studies, [https://web.archive.org/web/20101210054523/http://sacredstudies.org/bios.html Grandmother's Biographies] *Schaefer, C. (2006) Grandmothers Council the World: wise women elders offer their vision for our planet. Trumpeter Books 978-1-59030-293-4 == External links == *{{Cite web | title = Women Rising XI: International Council of the 13 Indigenous Grandmothers, featuring Rita Pitka Blumenstein, Flordemayo, and Beatrice Long-Visitor Holy Dance | work = Women Rising Radio Project | date = 2011-10-21 | url = http://www.womenrisingradio.com/2011/10/21/women-rising-xi-international-council-of-the-13-indigenous-grandmothers/#more-%27 }} * [http://www.grandmotherscouncil.com/ International Council of 13 of Indigenous Grandmothers Official Website] * [http://www.forthenext7generations.com/ Official website for documentary] * [http://vimeo.com/6538094 For The Next Seven Generations Film Trailer] * [http://sacredstudies.org/ The Center for Sacred Studies] *[https://web.archive.org/web/20090809110936/http://www.shambhala.com/html/catalog/items/isbn/978-1-59030-293-4.cfm?selectedText=EXCERPT_CHAPTER Statement of the International Council of Thirteen Indigenous Grandmothers] * [http://www.nativevillage.org/International%20Council%20of%2013%20INDIGENOUS%20GR/Each%20GR%20Home%20Page/Rita%20and%20Beatrice/Grandmother%20Rita%20and%20Beatrice%20Homepage.htm Grandmothers Rita and Beatrice Long Visitor Holy Dance Homepage at Native Village] {{DEFAULTSORT:Long Visitor Holy Dance, Beatrice}} [[Category:American humanitarians]] [[Category:American environmentalists]] [[Category:Female Native American leaders]] [[Category:Humanitarians]] [[Category:American Indian Movement]] [[Category:Native American activists]] [[Category:Religious figures of the indigenous peoples of North America]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Sustainability advocates]] [[Category:People from the Pine Ridge Indian Reservation, South Dakota]] [[Category:Lakota people]] [[Category:Year of birth missing (living people)]]

'''Bukhari''' or '''Bokhari''' ({{Script|Arab|بخاری}}) means "from [[Bukhara]]" in Persian, Arabic, and Hebrew, and may refer to: *[[Bukhari (surname)]], a nisba and surname *''[[Sahih al-Bukhari]]'', hadith collection made by [[Muhammad al-Bukhari]] (810–870), Sunni Islamic scholar from Bukhara *[[Bukharan Jews]] *[[Bukhori language]] '''Bukhari''' may also refer to: *[[Bukhari (heater)]], a type of [[space heater]] from North India and Pakistan

[[Harvard Divinity School]] (M.Div) |occupation = Journalist, writer, activist, clergyman |employer = |known_for = |spouse = }} '''Christopher Lynn Hedges''' (born September 18, 1956) is an American journalist, [[Presbyterian Church|Presbyterian]] minister, and visiting [[Princeton University]] lecturer. His books include ''[[War Is a Force That Gives Us Meaning]]'' (2002), a finalist for the [[National Book Critics Circle Award for Nonfiction]]; ''Empire of Illusion: The End of Literacy and the Triumph of Spectacle'' (2009); ''Death of the Liberal Class'' (2010); ''[[Days of Destruction, Days of Revolt]]'' (2012), written with cartoonist [[Joe Sacco]], which was a ''[[The New York Times|New York Times]]'' best-seller; ''Wages of Rebellion: The Moral Imperative of Revolt'' (2015); and his most recent ''America: The Farewell Tour'' (2018). Hedges is a columnist for the progressive news and commentary website [[Truthdig]].[http://www.truthdig.com/about Truthdig: About Us]{{cite news |date=August 19, 2011 |url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2011/08/19/idUS428147016120110819 |title=Reuters Ex-LA Times Writer Mark Heisler Vents Again About Tribune |publisher=Reuters |accessdate=January 15, 2015}} He is also a host for the television program ''On Contact'' on [[RT (TV network)|RT]].[https://www.rt.com/usa/345205-chris-hedges-on-contact/ ‘On Contact’: Pulitzer Prize-winning journalist Chris Hedges joins RT America], ''RT.'' 2 June 2016 Hedges spent nearly two decades as a foreign correspondent in [[Central America]], [[Western Asia|West Asia]], [[Africa]], the Middle East, and the [[Balkans]]. He has reported from more than fifty countries, and has worked for ''[[The Christian Science Monitor]]'', [[NPR]], ''[[Dallas Morning News]]'', and ''[[The New York Times]]'',{{cite web |url=http://authors.simonandschuster.com/Chris-Hedges/21025518|title=Simon & Schuster, "Authors: Chris Hedges"|work=Simon & Schuster|accessdate=November 27, 2014}} where he was a foreign correspondent for fifteen years (1990–2005). In 2001, Hedges contributed to ''The New York Times'' staff entry that received the 2002 [[Pulitzer Prize for Explanatory Reporting]] for the paper's coverage of global terrorism. He also received the [[Amnesty International]] Global Award for Human Rights Journalism in 2002.{{cite web |title = Chris Hedges, Columnist |publisher = Truthdig |url = https://www.truthdig.com/staff/chris_hedges#bio |accessdate = 2013-09-28 }} He has taught at [[Columbia University]], [[New York University]], the [[University of Toronto]] and [[Princeton University]], where he is a visiting lecturer in [[African American studies]].{{cite web|title=Visiting Journalism Professors Roster 1964–2015|url=http://humanities.princeton.edu/journalism/professors/past|accessdate=28 April 2016|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160531003156/http://humanities.princeton.edu/journalism/professors/past|archivedate=May 31, 2016|df=mdy-all}}{{cite web |title=Anshutz Distinguished Fellowship in American Studies |url=https://www.princeton.edu/ams/anschutz/ |accessdate=28 April 2016 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160425054658/http://www.princeton.edu/ams/anschutz/ |archivedate=April 25, 2016 |df=mdy }}{{cite web|title=In Conversation with Brian Steward: Pulitzer-Prize Winning Journalist Christopher Hedges|url=http://munkschool.utoronto.ca/csus/event/9717/print/|accessdate=28 April 2016}} Hedges has taught college credit courses for several years in New Jersey prisons. He teaches a course through Princeton University in which the class is composed of half prisoners and half Princeton undergraduates. He has described himself as a [[socialist]]{{cite web |last=Hedges|first=Chris |url=http://www.truthdig.com/report/item/20081229_why_i_am_a_socialist/|title=Why I Am a Socialist|publisher=Truthdig|date=December 29, 2008}}{{cite book |last=Hedges |first=Chris |date=August 21, 2018 |title=America: The Farewell Tour |url= |location= |publisher=[[Simon & Schuster]] |page=303 |isbn=978-0-73527-596-6 |author-link= }} and more specifically as a [[Christian anarchism|Christian anarchist]],Chris Hedges Interviewed at NYSEC [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tZSjKVijpjE&t=57m3s Youtube] Assessed 12/15/2016Chris Hedges on What it Takes to be a Rebel in Modern Times [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BUgaqJZLwOg&t=16m21s Youtube] Assessed 12/15/2016 identifying with Catholic activist [[Dorothy Day]] in particular.Occupy Tactics – Violence and Legitimacy in the Occupy Movement and Beyond [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=F_cyzgYLaK4&t=1h15m31s Youtube] Assessed 12/15/2016 ==Early life== Christopher Lynn Hedges was born in [[St. Johnsbury, Vermont]], the son of Thelma Louise (''née'' Prince) and the Rev. Thomas Havard Hedges, a [[Presbyterian]] minister.{{cite web|url=http://www.princetonmagazine.com/wordpress/?p=1749 |title=Chris Hedges The News Is Not Good |author=Ellen Gilbert |publisher=Princeton Magazine |date=February 2, 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140423211814/http://www.princetonmagazine.com/wordpress/?p=1749 |archivedate=April 23, 2014 }}[https://familysearch.org/ark:/61903/1:1:KFBV-4CZ Chris Hedges in FamilySearch] He grew up in rural [[Schoharie County, New York]], southwest of Albany. He graduated in 1975 from the [[Loomis Chaffee School]], a private [[boarding school]] in [[Windsor, Connecticut]].{{cite web | url=http://www.collegequarterly.ca/2012-vol15-num01-winter/doughty.html | title =I Don't Believe in Atheists | author =Chris Hedges |author2=Howard A. Doughty | publisher =collegequarterly.ca | year =2008}}{{cite web | url=http://www.loomischaffee.org/page.cfm?p=3613 | title =Notable Alumni Humanitarianism and Public Service | publisher =loomischaffee.org | date =May 15, 2013}} He founded an underground newspaper at the school that was banned by the administration and resulted in his being put on probation.{{cite news | url=http://articles.courant.com/2003-02-21/news/0302210468_1_chris-hedges-iraq-poison | title =Writer Shares War Stories | author =Johnny Mason | newspaper=Hartford Courant |accessdate=January 15, 2015}} Hedges received his [[Bachelor of Arts]] degree in English from [[Colgate University]] in 1979. He received a [[Master of Divinity]] degree from [[Harvard Divinity School]] (where he studied under [[James Luther Adams]]) in 1983.{{cite web|url=https://www.pbs.org/wnet/religionandethics/week622/hedges.html |title=Interview: Chris Hedges |publisher=PBS |date=January 31, 2003 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130310151925/http://www.pbs.org/wnet/religionandethics/week622/hedges.html |archivedate=March 10, 2013 }} He speaks [[English language|English]], [[Arabic language|Arabic]], [[French language|French]], and [[Spanish language|Spanish]], and studied [[Latin]] and [[Classical Greek]] at Harvard. == ''The New York Times'' == Hedges worked for 15 years as a foreign correspondent for ''[[The New York Times]]''. He was based in the Middle East for five years, serving for four of those years as the Middle East bureau chief. He covered the war in the former Yugoslavia as the Balkan bureau chief based in Sarajevo. He later covered [[Al Qaeda]] in Europe and the Middle East from Paris. Three of Hedges' articles were based upon the stories of Iraqi defectors, who had been furnished to Hedges by the Information Collection Program of the U.S.-funded [[Iraqi National Congress]].[http://www.commondreams.org/headlines04/0316-02.htm Jonathan S. Landay and Tish Wells, "Global Misinformation Campaign was Used to Build Case for War" ''Knight-Ridder'', March 16, 2004] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131117010917/http://www.commondreams.org/headlines04/0316-02.htm |date=November 17, 2013 }} The program promoted stories to major media outlets in order to orchestrate U.S. intervention in Iraq in the aftermath of the [[September 11 attacks|9/11 attacks]]. Most significant of his reports in this period was a November 8, 2001, front-page story about two former [[Saddam Hussein and al-Qaeda link allegations|Iraqi military commanders who claimed to have trained foreign mujahedeen]] how to hijack planes without using guns.{{cite news | url = http://www.alternet.org/story/19210/ahmed_chalabi's_list_of_suckers | first = Douglas | last = McCollam | title = Ahmed Chalabi's List of Suckers: Judith Miller is only one of the many reporters from almost every blue-blooded news outfit in America who were played by the Iraqi exile | date = July 12, 2004| work = [[Alternet]] | accessdate = 2013-11-22 | quote = Chris Hedges of ''The New York Times'' wrote a page-one piece headlined "Defectors Cite Iraqi Training for Terrorism".}} Hedges quoted a man whom he believed to be an Iraqi general: "These Islamic radicals ... came from a variety of countries, including Saudi Arabia, Yemen, Algeria, Egypt, and Morocco. We were training these people to attack installations important to the United States". The two defectors also asserted there was a secret compound in [[Salman Pak facility]] where a German scientist was producing biological weapons.{{cite news | url = https://www.nytimes.com/2001/11/08/international/middleeast/08IRAQ.html%20| first = Chris | last = Hedges | title = Defectors Cite Iraqi Training for Terrorism | date = November 8, 2001 | work = [[The New York Times]] | accessdate = 2013-11-17}} According to ''[[Mother Jones (magazine)|Mother Jones]]'': "The impact of the article ... was immediate: Op-eds ran in major papers, and the story was taken to a wider audience through cable-TV talk shows. When [[Condoleezza Rice]], then George W. Bush's national security adviser, was asked about the report at a press briefing, she said, 'I think it surprises no one that Saddam Hussein is engaged in all kinds of activities that are destabilizing.{{'"}} As late as 2006, conservative magazines including ''[[The Weekly Standard]]'' and ''[[National Review]]'' continued to use this article to justify the invasion of Iraq.{{cite news | first = Jack | last = Fairweather | title = Heroes in Error | date = March 2006 | url = https://www.motherjones.com/politics/2006/03/heroes-error | work = [[Mother Jones (magazine)|Mother Jones]]| accessdate = 2013-11-17 | quote = How a fake general, a pliant media, and a master manipulator helped lead the United States into war.}} It later was revealed that the story which Hedges reported was "an elaborate scam". The defector whom Hedges quoted, who had identified himself as Lt. General Jamal al-Ghurairy, was a former sergeant. The real Ghurairy had never left Iraq. Hedges said that he had taken on reporting this account at the request of [[Lowell Bergman]] of ''[[Frontline (U.S. TV program)|Frontline]]'', who wanted the defectors for his show but could not go to Beirut for the interview. The trip had been organized by [[Ahmed Chalabi]], whom Hedges considered to be unreliable. Hedges said he had done the piece as a favor to Bergman, explaining, "There has to be a level of trust between reporters. We cover each other's sources when it's a good story because otherwise everyone would get hold of it." Hedges had relied on the U.S. embassy in Turkey for further confirmation of the man's identity. Hedges wrote two more articles that year that were informed by Chalabi-coached defectors. The second one, claiming that Iraq still held 80 Kuwaitis captured in the 1991 Gulf War in a secret underground prison, was also found to be baseless.{{cite web|url=http://www.commondreams.org/headlines04/0316-02.htm |author1=Jonathan S. Landay |author2=Tish Wells |work=[[Knight-Ridder]] |date=March 16, 2004 |title=Iraqi Exile Group Fed False Information to News Media – Global Misinformation Campaign was Used to Build Case for War |accessdate=December 2, 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131117010917/http://www.commondreams.org/headlines04/0316-02.htm |archivedate=November 17, 2013 }} ==Political views and activism== Hedges was an early critic of the [[Iraq War]]. In May 2003, Hedges delivered a commencement address at [[Rockford University|Rockford College]] in Rockford, Illinois, saying: "We are embarking on an occupation that, if history is any guide, will be as damaging to our souls as it will be to our prestige and power and security."{{YouTube|SAWMgYyAtHU|Footage of the speech}}; Rockford College, May 2003 His speech was received with boos and his microphone was shut off three minutes after he began speaking.{{cite news |url=http://www.democracynow.org/2003/5/21/new_york_times_reporter_chris_hedges|title=New York Times Reporter, Chris Hedges was Booed off the Stage and had his Microphone Cut Twice as he Delivered a Graduation Speech on War and Empire at Rockford College in Illinois |publisher=[[Democracy Now!]] |date=May 21, 2014 |accessdate=November 24, 2014}} {{American socialism |People}} ''The New York Times'', his employer, criticized his statements and issued him a formal reprimand for "public remarks that could undermine public trust in the paper's impartiality".Hedges, Chris; [http://www.dallasnews.com/sharedcontent/dws/dn/religion/stories/DN-main_17rel.ART.State.Edition1.21b687c.html A Father's Gift], ''[[Dallas Morning News]]'', 17 June 2006, accessed December 21, 2010 {{dead link|date=June 2016|bot=medic}}{{cbignore|bot=medic}} Shortly after the incident, Hedges left ''The New York Times'' to become a senior fellow at [[The Nation Institute]], and a columnist at [[Truthdig]], in addition to writing books and teaching inmates at a New Jersey correctional institution.[http://www.nationinstitute.org/fellows/1328/chris_hedges The Nation Institute] Hedges has worked for a decade teaching in prisons in New Jersey, and he has become a fierce critic of [[Incarceration in the United States|mass incarceration in the United States]].{{cite news |author=Marshall "Eddie" Conway |author2=Chris Hedges |url=http://therealnews.com/t2/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=31&Itemid=74&jumival=12928 |title=How Prisons Rip Off and Exploit the Incarcerated (1/2) |publisher=The Real News |date=January 4, 2015 |accessdate=January 15, 2015}}Chris Hedges (December 29, 2014). [http://www.truthdig.com/report/item/the_prison_state_of_america_20141228 The Prison State of America]. Truthdig. Retrieved January 6, 2015. In the 2008 United States presidential campaign, Hedges was a speech writer for candidate [[Ralph Nader]].{{cite news |url=http://progressive.org/chris_hedges_interview.html |author=David Barsamian |title=An Interview with Chris Hedges |date=August 2011 |work=The Progressive |accessdate=November 27, 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141204135757/http://www.progressive.org/chris_hedges_interview.html |archivedate=December 4, 2014 |df=mdy-all }} In his December 29, 2008, column for Truthdig, Hedges stated that "[t]he inability to articulate a viable socialism has been our gravest mistake. It will ensure, if this does not soon change, a ruthless [[Inverted totalitarianism|totalitarian capitalism]]". He elaborated upon this in a 2013 interview with The Real News, claiming that
"the left has been destroyed, especially the [[Far-left politics|radical left]], quite consciously in the whole name of [[Anti-communism#United States|anti-communism]]", and "we have allowed ourselves to embrace an ideology which, at its core, states that all governance is about maximizing corporate profit at the expense of the citizenry. For what do we have structures of government, for what do we have institutions of state, if not to hold up all the citizenry, and especially the most vulnerable?".[http://www.truthdig.com/avbooth/item/chris_hedges_the_left_has_been_destroyed_20130722/?ln Chris Hedges: 'The Left Has Been Destroyed']. Truthdig, July 22, 2013.
In a March 2009 column, Hedges warned that [[Human overpopulation|human over-population]] and [[Holocene extinction|mass species extinction]] are serious problems, and that any measures to save the ecosystem will be futile unless we cut population growth, and noted that, "As long as the Earth is viewed as the personal property of the human race, a belief embraced by everyone from born-again Christians to Marxists to free-market economists, we are destined to soon inhabit a biological wasteland."{{cite web |url=https://www.truthdig.com/articles/we-are-breeding-ourselves-to-extinction/|title=We Are Breeding Ourselves to Extinction|last=Hedges |first=Chris |date=March 9, 2009|website= Truthdig|publisher= |access-date= January 19, 2018}} On December 8, 2009, Hedges identified as a "radical Keynesian" during his lecture at [[The New School]], entitled "Empire of Illusion".{{Cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_EpeF1fcji0|title=Chris Hedges' Empire of Illusion {{!}} The New School|last=Hedges|first=Chris|date=December 16, 2009|website=''[[YouTube]]''|publisher=[[The New School]]|access-date=August 29, 2016}} On December 16, 2010, Hedges was arrested outside the White House along with [[Daniel Ellsberg]] and more than 100 activists who were protesting the war in Afghanistan.{{cite news |url=http://www.truthdig.com/avbooth/item/hope_is_action_hedges_ellsberg_arrested_at_white_house_protest_20101217 |title='Hope Is Action': Hedges and Ellsberg Arrested at White House Protest|publisher=Truthdig|date=2010-12-17|accessdate=2014-11-24}}{{cite news |url=http://www.rawstory.com/rs/2010/12/untitled-chris-hedges-interview/ | title=Exclusive: US empire could collapse at any time, Pulitzer winner tells Raw Story |publisher=[[The Raw Story]]|date=December 17, 2010|accessdate=2014-11-24}} Hedges appeared as a guest on an October 2011 episode of the [[CBC News Network]]'s ''[[Lang and O'Leary Exchange]]'' to discuss his support for the [[Occupy Wall Street]] protests; co-host [[Kevin O'Leary]] criticized him, saying that he sounded "like a left-wing nutbar". Hedges said "it will be the last time" he appears on the show, and compared the CBC to [[Fox News]].James Crugnale (October 12, 2011). [http://www.mediaite.com/tv/journalist-chris-hedges-argues-with-cbcs-kevin-oleary-this-sounds-like-fox-news-and-i-don%E2%80%99t-go-on-fox-news/ Journalist Chris Hedges Argues With CBC's Kevin O'Leary: 'This Sounds Like Fox News And I Don't Go On Fox News!'], ''[[Mediaite]].'' Retrieved January 24, 2014. CBC's ombudsman found O'Leary's heated remarks to be a violation of the public broadcaster's journalistic standards.{{cite news |author=Cassandra Szklarski |url=http://www.huffingtonpost.ca/2011/10/14/oleary-nutbar-ombudsman_n_1011373.html |title=Kevin O'Leary 'Nutbar' Remark Violated Journalistic Standards: CBC Ombudsman]. |publisher=The Huffington Post Canada |date=October 14, 2011 |accessdate=January 24, 2014}} On November 3, 2011, Hedges was arrested with others in New York as part of the [[Occupy Wall Street]] demonstration, during which the activists staged a "people's hearing"[http://www.truthdig.com/report/item/chris_hedges_arrested_in_front_of_goldman_sachs_20111103/ Chris Hedges Arrested in Front of Goldman Sachs]. Truthdig. November 3, 2011. on the activities of the investment bank [[Goldman Sachs]] and blocked the entrance to their corporate headquarters.{{cite news |author=Rich Schapiro |author2=Helen Kennedy |date=November 3, 2011 |url=http://www.nydailynews.com/new-york/a-dozen-occupy-wall-street-protesters-arrested-goldman-sachs-article-1.971807 |title=More than a dozen Occupy Wall Street protesters arrested outside Goldman Sachs, Reporter/Activist Chris Hedges among those charged] |newspaper=[[Daily News (New York)|Daily News]] |location=New York |accessdate=2011-11-04}}{{YouTube|w9qPGzqpuYc|RTAmerica}} Hedges has appeared on the syndicated ''[[Democracy Now!]]'' television program; on ''[[Breaking the Set]]'' on [[RT (TV network)|RT]] (formerly known as Russia Today), and on CBC's ''[[George Stroumboulopoulos Tonight]]''.[http://www.democracynow.org/appearances/chris_hedges Shows featuring Chris Hedges]. The Real News, September 21, 2014 Hedges and Klein also participated in the 'Flood Wall Street' protests that occurred shortly thereafter.{{cite news |author=John Light |author2=Joshua Holland |url=http://billmoyers.com/2014/09/23/flood-wall-street/ |title=After People's Climate March, Thousands Re-Kindle Occupy Wall Street |publisher=[[Moyers & Company]] |date=September 23, 2014 |accessdate=January 15, 2015}} On November 11, 2014, Hedges published an article explaining why he and his family have become [[Veganism|vegan]]. He explained that this is "the most important and direct change we can immediately make to save the planet and its species".{{cite web |url=http://www.truthdig.com/report/item/saving_the_planet_one_meal_at_a_time_20141109|title=Saving the Planet, One Meal at a Time|publisher=Truthdig|date=November 10, 2014}} In a December 15, 2014, article, Hedges compared the actions of [[Islamic State of Iraq and Syria|ISIS]] today to the way [[Israel]]'s founding fathers acted in the late 1940s.{{cite web |last1=Hedges|first1=Chris|title=ISIS-The New Israel|url=http://www.truthdig.com/report/item/isis_--_the_new_israel_20141214|website=TruthDig}} Hedges contended at the Left Forum in 2015 that with the "denouement of capitalism and the disintegration of globalism", [[Karl Marx]] has been "vindicated as capitalism's most prescient and important critic". He said that Marx "foresaw that capitalism had built within it the seeds of its own destruction. He knew that reigning ideologies—think [[neoliberalism]]—were created to serve the interests of the elites and in particular the economic elites."Chris Hedges (May 31, 2015). [http://www.truthdig.com/report/item/karl_marx_was_right_20150531 Karl Marx Was Right]. ''Truthdig.'' Retrieved June 5, 2015. On April 15, 2016, Hedges was arrested, along with 100 other protesters, during a sit-in outside the U.S. Capitol during [[Democracy Spring]] to protest the capture of the political system by corporations.{{cite web |url=http://www.dcmediagroup.us/2016/04/15/rosario-dawson-arrested-100-democracy-spring-protesters-u-s-capitol|title=Rosario Dawson Among 100 Democracy Spring Protesters Arrested at U.S. Capitol|publisher=DCMediaGroup|date=April 15, 2016}} Commenting on the 2016 election during an interview on [[The Real News]], Hedges asserted that the modern American Left's embrace of neoliberalism resulted in a dysfunctional democracy and has given rise to a Trump presidency, which he characterizes as "[[Proto-fascism|proto-fascist]]".[http://therealnews.com/t2/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=31&Itemid=74&jumival=17650 Chris Hedges: The Surrender of the Liberal Left to Neoliberalism Gave Us Proto-fascism]. ''[[The Real News]].'' November 10, 2016. Hedges argues that logical result of neoliberalism is neofascism.{{cite web |url=https://www.truthdig.com/articles/neoliberalisms-dark-path-to-fascism/|title=Neoliberalism's Dark Path to Fascism|last=Hedges |first=Chris|date=November 26, 2018|website=Truthdig |publisher= |access-date=November 26, 2018 |quote=}} At a March 2017 speech delivered in [[Vancouver, British Columbia]], Hedges insisted that resistance to the Trump Administration must be broadly socialist and anti-capitalist in nature:
This resistance must also be accompanied by an alternative vision of a socialist, anti-capitalist society. Because the enemy in the end is not Trump or Bannon—it is corporate power. And if we do not stop corporate power, we will never dismantle fascism's seduction of the white working class and unemployed."[http://www.truthdig.com/avbooth/item/chris_hedges_enemy_donald_trump_or_steve_bannon_corporate_power_20170315 Chris Hedges: The Enemy Is Not Donald Trump or Steve Bannon—It Is Corporate Power (Video)] Truthdig. March 15, 2017
==NDAA lawsuit== {{Main|Hedges v. Obama}} In 2012, after the Obama Administration signed the [[National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2012|National Defense Authorization Act]], or NDAA, Hedges sued members of the U.S. government, claiming that section 1021 of the law unconstitutionally allowed presidential authority for indefinite detention without ''[[habeas corpus]]''. He was later joined in the suit, ''[[Hedges v. Obama]]'', by activists including [[Noam Chomsky]] and [[Daniel Ellsberg]]. In May 2012 Judge [[Katherine B. Forrest]] of the Southern District of New York ruled that the counter-terrorism provision of the NDAA is unconstitutional.{{cite news |last=Kuipers|first=Dean|title=Federal judge blocks National Defense Authorization Act provision |url=http://www.latimes.com/news/local/environment/la-me-gs-national-defense-authorization-ruling-20120518,0,2046039.story|newspaper=Los Angeles Times|date=May 18, 2012}} The Obama administration appealed the decision and it was overturned. Hedges petitioned the U.S. Supreme Court to hear the case,{{cite news | url=http://www.businessinsider.com/unbelievable-obama-administration-has-already-appealed-ndaa-ruling-2012-9 | title =Obama Has Already Appealed The Indefinite Detention Ruling | author =David Seaman | publisher =Business Insider | date =September 13, 2012}} but the Supreme Court denied [[certiorari]] in April 2014.{{cite web |last=Denniston|first=Lyle|title=Detention challenge denied|url=http://www.scotusblog.com/2014/04/detention-challenge-denied/|publisher=SCOTUSblog|accessdate=April 29, 2014|date=April 28, 2014}}{{cite web |title=Order List: 572 U. S. 13-758 Hedges, Christopher, et Al. V. Obama, Pres. Of U.S., et Al. – Certiorari Denied|publisher=United States Supreme Court|accessdate=April 29, 2014|page=7|url=https://www.supremecourt.gov/orders/courtorders/042814zor_6k47.pdf|date=April 29, 2014}} ==Ordination and ministerial installation== On October 5, 2014, Hedges was ordained a [[Minister (Christianity)|minister]] within the [[Presbyterian Church (U.S.A.)|Presbyterian Church]]. He was installed as Associate Pastor and Minister of Social Witness and Prison Ministry at the Second Presbyterian Church Elizabeth in [[Elizabeth, New Jersey]].{{cite web |url=http://www.secpreseliz.org/leadership|title=Leadership of the Second Presbyterian Church in Elizabeth, NJ |publisher= |date= |accessdate=April 27, 2015}} He noted having been rejected for ordination 30 years earlier, saying that "going to [[El Salvador]] as a reporter was not something the Presbyterian Church at the time recognized as a valid ministry, and a committee rejected my 'call{{'"}}.{{cite web |url=https://www.truthdig.com/report/item/ordained_to_write_20141013|title=Ordained to Write|publisher=Truthdig|date=October 13, 2014|accessdate=October 19, 2014}} ==Personal life== Chris Hedges is married to the Canadian actress Eunice Wong.{{cite web |url= http://www.eunicewong.com/biography |title= Eunice Wong: Biography |accessdate= May 14, 2016}} The couple have two children. Hedges also has two children from a previous marriage. He currently lives in Princeton, New Jersey.{{cite web |url=http://www.americanswhotellthetruth.org/portraits/chris-hedges |title=Americans Who Tell the Truth.org "Chris Hedges Biography" |publisher=Robert Shetterly |accessdate=January 15, 2015}} ==Books== * 2002: ''[[War Is a Force That Gives Us Meaning]]'' ({{ISBN|1586480499}}) * 2003: ''What Every Person Should Know About War'' ({{ISBN|1417721049}}) * 2005: ''Losing Moses on the Freeway: The 10 Commandments in America'' ({{ISBN|0743255135}}) * 2007: ''[[American Fascists|American Fascists: The Christian Right and the War on America]]'' ({{ISBN|0743284437}}) * 2008: ''I Don't Believe in Atheists'' ({{ISBN|141656795X}}) * 2008: ''Collateral Damage: America's War Against Iraqi Civilians'', with [[Laila Al-Arian]] ({{ISBN|1568583737}}) * 2009: ''When Atheism Becomes Religion: America's New Fundamentalists'', ({{ISBN|9781416570783}}), a retitled edition of ''I Don't Believe in Atheists'' * 2009: ''Empire of Illusion: The End of Literacy and the Triumph of Spectacle'' ({{ISBN|9781568584379}}) * 2010: ''Death of the Liberal Class'' ({{ISBN|9781568586441}}) * 2010: ''The World As It Is: Dispatches on the Myth of Human Progress'' ({{ISBN|9781568586403}}) * 2012: ''[[Days of Destruction, Days of Revolt]]'', with [[Joe Sacco]] ({{ISBN|9781568586434}}) * 2015: ''Wages of Rebellion: The Moral Imperative of Revolt'' ({{ISBN|1568589662}}) * 2016: ''Unspeakable'' ({{ISBN|1510712739}}) * 2018: ''America, The Farewell Tour'' ({{ISBN|978-1501152672}}) ==See also== * ''[[Hedges v. (Top 26) | spouse = | domestic_partner = | children = | homepage = | signature = }} | module2 = | module3 = }} '''Dewi Liana Seriestha'''{{cite news|url=http://seeds.theborneopost.com/2015/11/23/dewi-scores-another-win-for-sarawak-with-achievement-award/|title=Dewi scores another win for Sarawak with achievement award|last=Toyat|first=Jude|date=23 November 2015|work=[[The Borneo Post]]|accessdate=17 July 2016}} (born 7 September 1989) is a Malaysian [[Singing|singer]], [[Model (person)|model]] and a former [[beauty pageant]] titleholder. In 2014, she became the first Malaysian to win the [[Miss World Talent]] title in [[Miss World 2014]] competition.{{cite news|url=http://www.theborneopost.com/2014/12/16/a-first-for-malaysia-dewi-is-miss-talent-at-miss-world-finals/|title=A first for Malaysia – Dewi is Miss Talent at Miss World finals|last=Ten|first=Marilyn|date=16 December 2014|work=[[The Borneo Post]]|accessdate=10 May 2015}} ==Early life== Dewi Liana was born in Kuching, Sarawak to an [[Indonesia]]n musician of [[Indonesian Chinese|Chinese]] descent, Yudhi Seriestha and Malaysian [[Bidayuh]] singer, Catherine Noep Sigit.{{cite news|url=http://www.themalaymailonline.com/showbiz/article/ex-miss-world-contestant-dewi-lianas-second-single-album-in-the-works|title=Ex-Miss World contestant Dewi Liana’s second single album in the works|last=|first=|date=17 July 2016|work=[[Bernama]]|accessdate=17 July 2016}} She is the third of four sibling.{{cite news|url=http://www.theborneopost.com/2014/09/15/parents-touched-by-grand-reception-for-dewi/|title=Parents touched by grand reception for Dewi|last=Aubrey|first=Samuel|date=15 September 2014|work=[[The Borneo Post]]|accessdate=17 July 2016}} She won a national singing competition, ''Bintang Kecil [[RTM (Malaysia)|RTM]]'' in 2000.{{cite news|url=http://rage.com.my/get-personal-dewi-liana-seriestha/|title=GET PERSONAL: DEWI LIANA SERIESTHA|last=Lam|first=JC|date=6 January 2015|work=rage.com.my|accessdate=21 August 2015}} In 2005, she moved to [[Kuala Lumpur]] with her parents to pursue her career. Seriestha graduated from National Academy of Arts, Culture and Heritage (ASWARA) in November 2015. ==Career== ===2005-2010: ''Mentor'' and ''Miss Fair & Lovely World Harvest Festival 2010''=== In 2005, Seriestha made her national television debut in a singing competition, ''Mentor'', which was aired on [[TV3 (Malaysia)|TV3]].{{cite news|url=http://www.theborneopost.com/2014/08/17/the-multi-talented-dewi-seriestha/|title=The multi-talented Dewi Seriestha|last=|first=|date=17 August 2014|work=[[The Borneo Post]]|accessdate=8 July 2015}} She was only 16 and was the youngest finalist of the show. Seriestha also ventured into acting. In 2009-2010, she acted for [[Malay language|Malay]] drama,''Kembali'',''Nilai Cinta Diana'' and ''Patung Cinta'' for [[Radio Televisyen Malaysia]]. In 2010, she joined a Sarawak-based beauty pageant Miss [[Fair & Lovely (cosmetics)|Fair & Lovely]] World Harvest Festival where she finished as first-runner up and also a subsidiary title for Miss Talent.{{cite news|url=http://www.utusanborneo.com.my/content/jadi-ratu-kerana-berani-bermimpi|title=Jadi ratu kerana berani bermimpi|last=Luna|first=Sandy Mark|date=17 August 2014|work=[[The Borneo Post]]|accessdate=8 July 2015}} ===2014-2016: ''World Championships of Performing Arts'', ''Miss World 2014'' and first single=== In 2014, Seriestha was chosen to represent Malaysia at World Championships of Performing Arts.{{cite news|url=http://www.theborneopost.com/2014/07/31/dewi-shines-at-performing-arts-olympics/|title=Dewi shines at ‘Performing Arts Olympics’|last=Saai|first=Johnson K|date=31 July 2014|work=[[The Borneo Post]]|accessdate=7 July 2015}} She won the gold medal for classical opera, three silver medals for contemporary, world music and variety category (vocal), a special accolade under Industry Award and a medal for classical champion of WCOPA. In August 2014, she was crowned as [[Miss World Malaysia]] 2014 at Corus Hotel, [[Kuala Lumpur]] and represented [[Malaysia]] in [[Miss World 2014]] in [[London]]. She won the [[Miss World Talent]] title and was named one of the Top 25 quarter-finalist. For 2015 [[Eid al-Fitr]], Seriestha joined other 10 celebrities for a charity show held in [[Kuching]], [[Sarawak]] alongside Malaysian pop diva, [[Ziana Zain]] for the show "Aidilfitri with Ziana Zain & Friends".{{cite news|url=http://www.theborneopost.com/2015/07/09/ziana-zain-to-entertain-fans-at-high-tea/|title=Ziana Zain to entertain fans at high-tea|last=|first=|date=19 July 2015|work=[[The Borneo Post]]|accessdate=7 August 2015}} On 4 September 2015, Seriestha releases her first single, ''Hati Telah Dimiliki'' on [[Spotify]]{{cite news|url=https://play.spotify.com/album/3a36xwCZZWwjaeGn9HqS1v|title=Single-Hati Telah Dimiliku|last=|first=|date=3 September 2015|work=[[Spotify]]|accessdate=4 September 2015}} and [[iTunes Store|iTunes]].https://itunes.apple.com/album/hati-telah-dimiliki-single/id1035590859?v0=9988&ign-mpt=uo%3D1 The single is the theme song for a [[TV3 (Malaysia)|TV3]] series, ''Waris Kasih''. In November 2015, Dewi Liana was awarded Asia Outstanding Achievement Award during the Asia Golden Dragon Awards 2015/2016 for her series of achievements during the WCOPA as well as the [[Miss World 2014]]. Dewi performed at the national-level [[Chinese New Year]] open house at [[Sibu|Sibu Town Square]] in February 2016.{{cite news|url=http://www.theborneopost.com/2016/02/25/event-full-cny-open-house-expected-this-saturday/|title=Event-full CNY open house expected this Saturday|last=Ishak|first=Othman|date=25 February 2016|work=[[The Borneo Post]]|accessdate=17 July 2016}} The event was attended by the then Prime Minister of Malaysia, [[Najib Razak]]. In July 2016, Dewi announced that her second single is still in the works and she would be signing with [[Warner Music Group|Warner Music Malaysia]]. She composed the single herself. In December 2016, Dewi Liana performed at the national-level [[Christmas]] open house at [[Pavilion Kuala Lumpur]] alongside [[David Arumugam]], Cassidy Anderson and Michael Leaner.{{cite news|url=http://www.nst.com.my/news/2016/12/200138/religious-tolerance-cornerstone-united-malaysia-says-zahid|title=Religious tolerance is cornerstone of a united Malaysia, says Zahid|last=Ismail|first=Laili|date=28 December 2016|work=[[New Straits Times]]|accessdate=13 January 2017}} The event was attended by the then Deputy Prime Minister of Malaysia, [[Ahmad Zahid Hamidi]], Tourism and Culture Minister [[Mohamed Nazri Abdul Aziz]], Transport Minister [[Liow Tiong Lai]] and Human Resources Minister [[Richard Riot Jaem|Richard Riot Anak Jaem]]. ===2017-present: Second single and new label=== Dewi Liana's second single, "Seindah Berdua" was released to digital platforms such as [[iTunes]], [[Apple Music]] and [[Spotify]] on 20 January 2017, under [[Warner Music Group|Warner Music Malaysia]].{{cite news|url=https://play.spotify.com/album/5lV3WPQuu1i1Mv9T1znw0l|title=Seindah Berdua|last=|first=|date=21 January 2017|work=[[Spotify]]|accessdate=21 January 2017}} In May 2017, Dewi was chosen as the icon and a keynote speaker for International [[Dayak people|Dayak]] Culture Day in [[Bengkayang Regency]], Indonesia.{{cite news|url=https://www.newsarawaktribune.com.my/news/dewi-liana-to-headline-international-dayak-culture-day-2017/|title=Dewi Liana to headline International Dayak Culture Day 2017|last=|first=|date=27 May 2017|work=New Sarawak Tribune|accessdate=16 July 2017}} Dewi was also crowned ''The Most Beautiful Dayak Woman''. In July 2018, Dewi performed in a musical theater, ''Sarawak: An Indigenous Journey''. The musical theater is held in conjunction with the second edition of Rainforest Fringe Festival, a run-up to the [[Rainforest World Music Festival]]. {{cite news|url=http://www.buro247.sg/culture/art-and-design/sarawak-rainforest-fringe-festival-2018.html|title=Sarawak aims to be the next creative city for craft-making and design through the Rainforest Fringe Festival|last=Phillips|first=Tracy|date=10 May 2018|work=Buro 24/7|accessdate=17 May 2018}}{{cite news|url=https://www.thestar.com.my/metro/metro-news/2018/07/11/a-cultural-kaleidoscope-rainforest-fringe-festival-celebrates-sarawaks-indigenous-beauty-and-rich-hi/|title=A cultural kaleidoscope|last=Ling|first=Sharon|date=11 July 2018|work=The Star Online|accessdate=30 July 2018}} In October 2018, it was announced that the single "Seindah Berdua" has advanced into the semi-finals of the [[Anugerah Juara Lagu|33rd Anugerah Juara Lagu]]. {{cite news|url=http://www.mstar.com.my/hiburan/berita-hiburan/2018/10/23/muzik-muzik/|title=30 lagu bakal berentap dalam separuh akhir Muzik-Muzik ke 33|last=Hashim|first=Qamari|language=Malay|date=23 October 2018|work=mstar.com.my|accessdate=25 October 2018}} ==Other ventures== ===Product endorsements=== In October 2015, Dewi Liana signed a two-year contract as an ambassador with Furley Bioextracts. ==Discography== ===Singles=== ====As lead artist==== {| class="wikitable" |- style="background:#96c; text-align:center;" ! style="text-align:center;"| Year ! {{Infobox person | name = Dorothy Brooke | image = | alt = | caption = | birth_name = Dorothy Evelyn Gibson-Craig | birth_date = {{Birth date|1883|06|01}} | birth_place = [[Salisbury]], [[Wiltshire]], [[England]] | death_date = {{Death date and age|1955|06|10|1883|06|01}} | death_place = [[Heliopolis (Cairo suburb)|Heliopolis]], [[Egypt]] | nationality = | other_names = | occupation = | years_active = | known_for = Animal welfare | notable_works = }} '''Dorothy Brooke''' (1 June 1883 – 10 June 1955) was the founder of The Old War Horse Memorial Hospital in 1934 in [[Cairo]] – renamed [[Brooke Hospital for Animals|The Brooke Hospital for Animals]] in 1961. Developing from a single operation in Cairo into one of the world’s largest [[horse|equines]] welfare organisations, at work in many countries, with headquarters in London, it is known today as Brooke.
==Early life== Dorothy Brooke was born Dorothy Evelyn Gibson-Craig on 1 June 1883 in the Cathedral Close at [[Salisbury]], [[Wiltshire]], [[England]]. She was the daughter of Henry Vivian and Emily Dulcibella (Wilmot) Gibson-Craig. Her grandfather was the Rt. Hon. Sir [[William Gibson-Craig]] of [[Riccarton, Edinburgh|Riccarton]].<ref name=Burke>{{cite book|editor1-last=Mosley|editor1-first=Charles|title=Burke's Peerage, Baronetage & Knightage|date=2003|publisher=[[Burke's Peerage]] (Genealogical Books) Ltd|edition=107}}</ref> Her childhood was spent in [[Scotland]], Wiltshire and [[Hampshire]]. By family and friends, she was always called Dodo.<ref name=the_brooke>{{cite web|title=Dorothy Brooke|url=http://www.thebrooke.org/about-us/our-history/dorothy-brooke|website=Brooke Hospital for Animals|publisher=Brooke Hospital for Animals|accessdate=5 November 2015}}</ref>
She was first married in 1905 to Lt.-Col. James Gerald Lamb Searight, The [[Royal Scots]] (Lothian Regiment). They were divorced in 1926.<ref name=Burke />
In 1926 Brooke married again, to Major-General Geoffrey Francis Heremon Brooke, C.B., D.S.O., M.C. (1884–1966), 16th/5th Lancers.<ref name=Burke /> Geoffrey Brooke was a recognised horse expert and author. Among his many titles are Horse-Sense and Horsemanship of Today (1924); Horse Lovers (1927); Horsemanship: The Way of a Man with a Horse (1929); and Good Company (1954). He trained and rode his own [[Steeplechase (horse racing)|steeplechase]]rs, he was a [[polo|polo-player]] and [[Show jumping|show-jumper]]. He competed as a member of the British equestrian team in the [[Equestrian at the 1924 Summer Olympics|1924 Summer Olympics]], although he had broken his collarbone a few days earlier.<ref>p204 Geoffrey Brooke, 'Good Company'</ref>
Brooke had three children: Rodney Gerald Searight, born 1909; Pamela Searight, born 1915; and John Philip Searight, born 1917.
==Life in Cairo== In 1930, Geoffrey Brooke was appointed to the command of the British Cavalry Brigade in Egypt. It was at this time that Dorothy Brooke realised she would have to search for the old war horses, whom “she hated to remember yet could not forget”.<ref>p. 4, pb ed., [[Glenda Spooner]] (edit.), For Love of Horses, Diaries of Mrs Geoffrey Brooke</ref> She could not be in Egypt and fail to do so. She had been devoted to horses since her childhood.
==War Horses in Cairo== In 1919, the cavalry, artillery and draught horses that had served in the British Army in the Egypt and Palestine campaigns of [[World War I]] had been sold in their many thousands to a life of continuous hard labour and a painful old age. Many had been requisitioned in England and had served in the [[British yeomanry during the First World War|British Yeomanry]]. Some had seen active service on the [[Western Front (World War I)|Western Front]] before being drafted as remounts to the [[Near East]].<ref>p. 166, Marquess of Anglesey, A HIstory of the British Cavalry, Vol. 8</ref> Strict [[quarantine]] restrictions prevented the repatriation of the horses of the Australian and New Zealand Mounted Infantry.
During World War I, horses cast from the veterinary hospitals had initially been sold to Egyptian dealers. British residents in Cairo had protested so forcefully that this practice had been stopped.<ref>pp. 172-3, Maj.-Gen. Sir L.J. Blenkinsop and Lieut.-Col. J.W. Ramsey, History of the Great War based on Official Documents: Veterinary Services</ref>
After the Armistice, however, with 22,000 horses, mostly in Palestine and Sinai, requiring transport or disposal, the Remounts Directorate of the [[War Office]] ordered the local sale of all animals of 12 years and under that were deemed up to some work. Those over 12 and the unsound were destroyed.<ref>pp. 681-691, Blenkinsop, op. cit.</ref>
The surviving horses had not had an easy war. They had carried often far too much weight – up to {{convert|22|stone|kg}}. They had experienced rationing, withstood piercing cold, dust clouds and exhaustion. Some may also have suffered both severe and light wounds. They had covered great distances, and some had endured a summer in the heat of the [[Jordan Valley (Middle East)|Jordan Valley]].<ref>pp. 94-95 & 311-321, Lieut.-Col. R.M.P. Preston, The Desert Mounted Corps; pp. 188, 202-203, 233, 341, Anglesey, op. cit., Vol. 5; pp. 640-642, Capt. Cyril Falls, History of the Great War: Military Operations based on Official Documents, Egypt & Palestine, Part II, Vol. 2</ref>
By 1930, twelve years later, the war horses, many now of an advanced age, had been lost to view, toiling for the very poorest owners, or at night to avoid the police and Egyptian [[Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals|S.P.C.A.]], or in the stone [[quarry|quarries]]. Brooke had heard rumours from British residents who spoke of pitiful, emaciated creatures that they suspected were war horses. Their condition was said to be so bad that people could hardly bear to look at them.<ref name="ReferenceA">Glenda Spooner, For Love of Horses op.cit.</ref> She was advised there could be two hundred. Weeks passed before she found the first,<ref>Glenda Spooner,For Love of Horses op cit.</ref> but there were to be more than two hundred. In fact in the years from 1930 to 1934, she bought back 5,000 old army horses and mules.
{{See also|Horses in World War I}}
==Campaign== There were many challenges and obstacles throughout the early years of Brooke’s efforts. Progress was prolonged, and, as the wife of the senior cavalry officer in Egypt, she had strenuous social duties. Nevertheless, she acquired frail old horses when and where she found them.<ref name="ReferenceA"/> She raised money from her friends and from her own pocket, got together a Committee, and set in motion the Old War Horse Campaign of Rescue.<ref>p. 222, Geoffrey Brooke, op. cit.</ref> By April 1931, six months after her arrival in Egypt, she was writing to the Morning Post<ref>{{cite web|title=Dorothy Brooke's 1931 appeal|url=http://www.thebrooke.org/about-us/our-history/dorothy-brooke/dorothy-brookes-1931-appeal|website=Brooke Hospital for Animals|publisher=Brooke Hospital for Animals|accessdate=5 November 2015}}</ref> to appeal for funds. Thousands of readers responded. [[George V|King George V]] was one of her many supporters throughout the [[British Commonwealth]].<ref>p. 222, Geoffrey Brooke, op. cit.; Glenda Spooner, For Love of Horses op. cit.</ref>
At first, she used the premises of the Egyptian S.P.C.A., but this was to prove unrealistic in the long term, and it was difficult to find light, airy stables in Cairo – and to gain the necessary permission.<ref name="ReferenceB">Glenda Spooner, For Love of Horses op. cit.</ref> However, she was persistent in working to raise money. During the first summer leave, she produced an 8-page pamphlet. There were further appeals in the press.<ref name="ReferenceB"/>
Almost all the old war horses were totally unfit to stand a voyage home. They were pathetically grateful for a drink and for somewhere to lie down.
“As their ill-shod misshapen hooves felt the deep tibbin [broken barley straw] bed beneath them, there would be another doubting disbelieving halt. Then gradually they would lower their heads and sniff as though they could not believe their own eyes or noses. Memories, long forgotten, would then return when some stepped eagerly forwards towards the mangers piled high with [[Trifolium alexandrinum|berseem]], while others, with creaking joints, lowered themselves slowly on to the bed and lay, necks and legs outstretched. There they remained, flat out, until hand fed by the syces.”<ref>quoting Dorothy Brooke, Glenda Spooner, op. cit.</ref>
They were given days of rest, and feed, and treated to kindness, and then put out of what was, for so many, their extreme misery. Very few were returned to England.
==Buying Committee== Brooke had the services of a Buying Committee. It was composed largely of high-ranking British officers, where it is thought she the only woman. The Chairman was General Sir [[Charlton Spinks]], Sirdar of the Egyptian Army and fluent in Arabic. Other members included Major (later Brigadier) Roland Heveningham, R.A.V.C., who was to be first Veterinary Director of the Old War Horse Memorial Hospital, and Brigadier Geoffrey Brooke.<ref>Glenda Spooner, For Love of Horses op. cit.; p. 222, Geoffrey Brooke, op. cit.</ref>
The Committee was buying up to 60 or 70 animals every week, and scouts searched throughout Egypt. It was a grim task. Sometimes, one of the male committee members might be too anguished to remain at the table.<ref name="ReferenceB"/> In the years 1930 to 1934, some 5,000 horses and old army [[mule]]s were found. They were identified by their conformation and army brands. The price paid represented the cost to the owner of a replacement.
On a Friday, ‘Black Friday’, the day after Buying Day – and for nine months of the year, every year for four years – Dorothy Brooke would select those to be destroyed, quietly and without alarm, by humane killer.<ref name="ReferenceB"/>
Brooke never sought to blame the men and boys who through poverty and lack of knowledge, had failed their animals. The ‘tragic sight’ of the locally bred animals that appeared before the Buying Committee made her realise that a free hospital was needed – to which every poor owner could bring what might be his family’s sole earner, and obtain expert help and advice at the first signs of trouble instead of waiting hopelessly.<ref>Geoffrey Brooke, For Love of Horses op. cit.</ref> She had set up a separate fund almost from the start. She called this The Animal Assistance Fund.
==Criticism== Brooke attracted some criticism. Some of the British who were long familiar with Egypt felt that she was going too far in removing such a number of draught animals from a traditional economy. Others asserted that the Committee was buying frauds.<ref>Glenda Spooner, For love of Horses op. cit.</ref>
==Legacy== At the end of four years, the war horse campaign could be closed. The Old War Horse Memorial Hospital was founded. Dorothy Brooke gained permission for the Hospital to place a drinking trough at the [[Giza Necropolis|Pyramids]]. The Cairo city authorities eventually adopted a policy of sanding the slippery stretches of street.
Geoffrey and Dorothy Brooke moved from Egypt to [[India]], where Geoffrey became Major-General of Cavalry. There Dorothy, besides giving her time and energy to the affairs of the Hospital, “threw herself into working to alleviate the suffering she saw all about her”. She managed to return to Cairo for an annual visit.<ref name="ReferenceB"/>
==Death== The Brookes left India at the outbreak of [[World War II]]. After a gap – through precarious years for the Hospital – Dorothy Brooke was able to resume her trips to Egypt in 1946. In 1955, at their house in [[Heliopolis (Cairo suburb)|Heliopolis]], on the outskirts of Cairo, she was not well enough to travel back to Wiltshire. She is reported as having remarked to her husband, some weeks beforehand, “If I die – not that I am going to for ever so long – promise me you won’t go to my funeral service. I know it will only distress you and I shan’t be there myself.”<ref>p. 103, Glenda Spooner, For Love of Horses op. cit.</ref>
Dorothy Brooke died on 10 June 1955 and was buried in Cairo.<ref name=the_brooke />
“Looking back on all she had accomplished,” remarks [[Glenda Spooner]], “one can feel certain that she thought little of her own share and a great deal of other people’s, for that was ever her way. She was indeed overwhelmed with gratitude to those who had made the rescue of the horses possible and it was no mean achievement.” <ref name="ReferenceB"/>
After his stepfather’s death in 1966, Major Philip Searight succeeded Geoffrey Brooke as Chairman. He guided the organisation through a period of expansion.<ref>obit. Philip Searight, www.telegraph.co.uk</ref> Dorothy Brooke’s grandchildren and great-grandchildren have maintained a tradition of service to The Brooke.<ref name=the_brooke /> Ann Searight, her granddaughter, served as a Trustee 1979-2011 and in 2014 is Honorary Vice-President.

Sir L.J. Blenkinsop and Lieut.-Col. J.W. Ramsey, History of the Great War based on Official Documents by Direction of the Historical Section of the Committee of Imperial Defence: Veterinary Services, H.M. Stationery Office, 1925 * Capt. Cyril Falls, History of the Great War based on Official Documents by Direction of the Historical Section of the Committee of Imperial Defence: Military Operations, Egypt & Palestine, Part II, Vol. 2, facs. ed. The Imperial War Museum, first published H.M. Stationery Office 1930 * Lieut.-Colonel the Hon. R.M.P.
